title: What is the significance of the numbers 116 and 126 in Buddhist doctrines and how do they relate to masculine energy?
first_phrase: This text discusses Buddhist doctrines of enlightenment and how it produces a suspension of habitual patterns, enabling a masculine force in individuals to act against the current of conventional, mundane reality. The author then delves into the concept of mastering oneself and becoming dominant, drawing from influential texts and personal insights. The final 200 tokens touch on concepts of self-acceptance and taking responsibility, using the metaphor of rolling cylinders on unstable surfaces to reflect on life's challenges.

last_phrase: In conclusion, it is advisable to adopt "cab Eiè KuXíveipot" (like cylinders themselves: as compression and leveling rollers or even as launch slides) instead of heavy passive cylinders rolled on gravel and sand, or launched slides towards a target. This will provide better stability and reduce the chances of adverse reactions to impacts and imbalances. It is important to be aware of the deep and often unseen "Io" which can either be a great asset or a significant obstacle in magic. So, it is necessary to educate oneself, study, cultivate good habits and choose the right environment to unleash the full potential of our magical abilities.
